sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Bolt Projects Holdings Hits New 52-Week Low at USD 1.58
feed.summary: Bolt Projects Holdings, Inc. has reached a new 52-week low of USD 1.58 on November 17, 2025, marking a 70% decline over the past year. The microcap company, with a market capitalization of USD 11 million, faces significant financial challenges, evidenced by negative debt equity and return on equity metrics. This recent low highlights ongoing struggles despite some positive sales developments in June.

feed.title: Bolt Projects Holdings Updates Bylaws for Modern Governance - TipRanks
feed.summary: Bolt Projects Holdings (BSLK) amended its bylaws on October 17, 2025, to modernize its governance structure. These changes impact stockholder meeting procedures, including quorum requirements and director nominations. Spark, TipRanks' AI Analyst, rates BSLK as Underperform due to financial instability and bearish technical indicators.

feed.title: Bolt Projects Holdings Secures $20M Equity Purchase Agreement
feed.summary: Bolt Projects Holdings (BSLK) has entered into an equity purchase agreement with Ascent Partners Fund LLC, allowing the company to sell up to $20 million of its common stock. This agreement provides flexible financing options for working capital and general corporate purposes. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates BSLK as Neutral due to poor financial performance, negative profitability, and high leverage, with a $4.50 price target from other analysts.

feed.title: Bolt Projects Holdings, Inc. Stock (BSLK) Opinions on Recent Volatility and Insider Buying
feed.summary: Recent discussions on X concerning Bolt Projects Holdings, Inc. (BSLK) focus on the company's volatile stock price and insider trading activity. Users are noting a sharp premarket plunge followed by aggressive executive purchases, signaling mixed confidence. Despite concerns over recent insider sales, there is optimism about operational improvements and potential short squeezes due to high borrow rates.

feed.title: Bolt Projects Announces $4.25 Million Private Placement
feed.summary: Bolt Projects Holdings, Inc. announced a private placement of an aggregate of 913,979 shares of common stock or pre-funded warrants at $4.65 per share, expecting to raise approximately $4.25 million. Rodman & Renshaw LLC is acting as the exclusive placement agent. The company intends to use the net proceeds for working capital and other general corporate purposes.

feed.title: Bolt Projects announces $4.25 million private placement By Investing.com
feed.summary: Bolt Projects Holdings, Inc. has entered into definitive agreements for a private placement of 913,979 shares at $4.65 per share, aiming to raise approximately $4.25 million. The funds will be used for working capital and general corporate purposes. The company specializes in biomaterials for the beauty and personal care industry using its Vegan Silk Technology Platform.

feed.title: Golden arrow sponsor sells Bolt projects (BSLK) shares worth $142k
feed.summary: Golden Arrow Sponsor, LLC, a significant owner of Bolt Projects Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:BSLK), sold 44,197 shares for approximately $142,014 between August 11 and August 13, 2025. This insider selling occurred amidst a remarkable 517% surge in BSLK's stock price in the preceding week. Following these transactions, Golden Arrow Sponsor retains only 1 share of the company's common stock.

feed.title: Bolt projects holdings sees $10,733 in stock sales by major owner
feed.summary: Golden Arrow Sponsor, a major owner of Bolt Projects Holdings (NASDAQ: BSLK), sold shares worth $10,733 over two days in May, reducing its stake to 417,089 shares. These sales occurred as BSLK's stock continues to trade near its 52-week low, reflecting a significant decline over the past year. In other news, Bolt Projects Holdings has updated its 2025 revenue outlook, approved a 1-for-20 reverse stock split to meet Nasdaq listing requirements, and appointed Christine Battist to its Board of Directors.

feed.title: Bolt Projects Holdings appoints new director and audit chair
feed.summary: Bolt Projects Holdings (NASDAQ: BSLK) has appointed Christine Battist to its Board of Directors and as chairperson of the Audit Committee, effective February 20, 2025. This move comes as the company faces significant challenges, including a substantial stock price decline and potential delisting from Nasdaq, despite maintaining strong short-term liquidity. The company also recently raised $360,000 through a private placement to address its financial needs.

feed.title: BSLK stock touches 52-week low at $0.56 amid market challenges
feed.summary: BSLK stock has hit a 52-week low of $0.56, reflecting a 94.65% decline over the past year amidst market challenges. The company, now operating as Bolt Projects Holdings, Inc. following a merger, has undertaken significant corporate developments including new leadership and a Nasdaq listing. InvestingPro highlights BSLK's rapid cash burn, weak gross profit margins despite revenue growth, and pressing short-term financial obligations.

feed.title: Bolt Threads Completes Merger with Golden Arrow, Debuts as Publicly Traded Company
feed.summary: Bolt Threads, a biomaterials leader, has completed its merger with Golden Arrow Merger Corp (Nasdaq: GAMC) and will now trade as Bolt Projects Holdings Inc. under the symbol “BSLK” on Nasdaq starting August 14, 2024. Dan Widmaier will continue as CEO, aiming to transform consumer goods through sustainable, nature-derived alternatives. The company, known for its b-silk™ product, holds 49 granted patents and 171 pending applications, highlighting its innovation in the biomaterials space.
